intro: Neanotis hondae, commonly known as the Honduran neanotis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, Neanotis hondae is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
